14,
are in the neighborhood of $5000 for transmitting equipment to replace present
modulator and driver amplifier and provide one subcarrier channel. Receiver
adapters cost about $70 each or a complete receiver for the subcarrier channel
sells for about $100. Transmitting equipment is manufactured by the Gates Company
and receiving equipment by the Browning Laboratories.
The NAEB Engineering Committee is presently working on various types
of networks to supplement the tape network and the FM multiples system may offer
a solution to the problem in certain areas. However, as the range of the multiplex
system is the same as the present FM transmitter range, distances between member
stations is too great to organise a practical national network or even a regional
network in any but a few localities. Local networks in some areas do appear to be
a possibility. A further report will be forthcoming.
THE NAEB ENGINEERING COMMITTEE
John Brugger* WILL
Robia Blggy, WGSU
Bert on Halmberg* KUOM
Keith Ketcham, WGI \
Bdw. Kratt* WNYE
C. Ho Mensser, WSUI (Chairman)
